title: Relates to the sentencing of persistent child predators
summary: Provides that a person who is found to be a persistent child predator may be sentenced as a felon; defines persistent child predator as one who commits an enumerated misdemeanor offense and who has previously been convicted of two or more enumerated misdemeanors or felonies related to children; requires a hearing in which the people must show the necessity of a felony sentence by a preponderance of the evidence.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the penal law and the criminal procedure law, in relation to sentencing of persistent child predators
